text.0: agni i hold as herald the munificent the gracious son of strength who knoweth all that live as holy singer knowing all.
text.1: lord of fair rites a god with form erected turning to the gods.
text.2: he when the flame hath sprung forth from the holy oil the offered fatness longeth for it with his glow.
text.3: we sacrificing call on thee best worshipper the eldest of aṅgirases singer with hymns thee brilliant one with singers hymns.
text.4: thee wandering round as t were the sky who art the invoking priest of men.
text.5: whom bull with hair of flame the people must observe the people that he speed them on.
text.6: he with his shining glory blazing far and wide he verily it is who slayeth demon foes slayeth the demons like an axe.
text.7: at whose close touch things solid shake and what is stable yields like trees.
text.8: subduing all he keeps his ground and flinches not from the skilled archer flinches not.
text.9: to him as one who knows even things solid yield unrough firesticks heated hot he gives his gifts to aid men offer agni gifts for aid.
text.10: he deeply piercing many a thing hews it like wood with fervent glow.
text.11: even hard and solid food he crunches with his might yea hard and solid food with might.
text.12: here near we place the sacrificial food for him who shines forth fairer in the night than in the day with life then stronger than by day.
text.13: his life gives sure and firm defence as that one giveth to a son.
text.14: the during fires enjoy things given and things not given the during fires enjoy as food.
text.15: he roaring very loudly like the maruts host in fertile cultivated fields adorable in desert spots adorable.
text.16: accepts and eats our offered gifts ensign of sacrifice by desert.
text.17: so let all joying love his path when he is glad as men pursue a path for bliss.
text.18: even as they who sang forth hymns addressed to heaven the bhṛgus with their prayer and praise invited him the bhṛgus rubbing offering gifts.
text.19: for radiant agni lord of all these treasures is exceeding strong.
text.20: may he the wise accept the grateful coverings the wise accept the coverings.
text.21: thee we invoke the lord of all our settled homes common to all the households guardian to enjoy bearer of true hymns to enjoy.
text.22: thee we invoke the guest of men by whose mouth even as a sires.
text.23: all these immortals come to gain their food of life oblations come to gods as food.
text.24: thou agni most victorious with thy conquering strength most mighty one art born for service of the gods like wealth for service of the gods.
text.25: most mighty is thine ecstasy most splendid is thy mental power.
text.26: therefore men wait upon thee undecaying one like vassals undecaying one.
text.27: to him the mighty conquering with victorious strength to agni walking with the dawn who sendeth kine be sung your laud to agni sung.
text.28: as he who with oblation comes calls him aloud in every place.
text.29: before the brands of fire he shouteth singerlike the herald kindler of the brands.
text.30: agni beheld by us in nearest neighbourhood accordant with the gods bring us with gracious love great riches with thy gracious love.
text.31: give us o mightiest what is great to see and to enjoy the earth.
text.32: as one of awful power stir up heroic might for those who praise thee bounteous lord.
